name: command-generator
title: Command Generator
description: Describe functionality in natural language and receive production-ready Raycast commands.
author: nbbaier

commands.name: manage-generated-commands
commands.title: Run Generated Commands
commands.description: Execute and manage AI-generated command specifications

commands.name: command-library
commands.title: Command Templates
commands.description: Browse and instantiate pre-built command templates

tools.name: generate-typescript-command
tools.title: Generate Command Spec
tools.description: Generates an executable command specification (JSON) that runs immediately in the command runner. Supports list, form, detail, and view modes with HTTP requests, shell execution, and data transforms. Optionally exports a standalone TypeScript extension.

tools.name: generate-script-command
tools.title: Generate Script Command
tools.description: Generates a shell or Node.js script with a CommandSpec to execute it. Can export as a Raycast Script Command with metadata headers for manual installation.

tools.name: analyze-command
tools.title: Analyze Command
tools.description: Analyzes existing Raycast command or script code, provides explanations, converts to CommandSpec, or exports as standalone extension with improvements.

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
